full_text: oC by NARA, U PLEDGE AND POWER OF ATTORNEY FOR USE WHEN CASH IS DEPOSITED AS SECURITY The amount of ($ ), cash money of the United States, is hereby pledged as security for the performance and fulfillment of the foregoing undertaking in accordance with section 213 of the Immigration and Nationality Act, and I the obligor named in this bond do hereby appoint the Attorney General of the United States as my attorney for me and in my name to collect or to assign and transfer the said sum of money, and I agree that, in the case of any default in the performance of any of the conditions herein to which I have subscribed, my said attorney shall have full power to collect said sum of money or any part thereof or to assign and transfer said sum or any part thereof, without notice and to apply said sum or any part thereof to the satisfaction of any damages, demands, or deficiencies arising by reason of such default, as my said attorney may deem best. I further empower my said attorney, in the event all the conditions herein to which I have subscribed have been complied with and the bond is canceled, to deliver the said sum of money plus any interest accrued thereon, to me at my risk and expense by such means as he shall select. IN WITNESS WHEREOF, I have hereunto set my hand and seal this day of 19 (SEAL) Before me, the undersigned, a notary public within and for the county of in the State of (or the District of Columbia), personally appeared the above- named and acknowledged the execution of the foregoing power of attorney. Witness my hand and notarial seal this day of , 19 . (NOTARIAL SEAL) Notary Public My commission expires INSTRUCTIONS This form shall be excuted in duplicate. The full name and residence of the obligor shall be stated and his signature, which shall conform thereto, must be witnessed by two other persons who shall sign their names and state in full their places of residence. However, no witnesses are required to the signature of an agent of an acceptable surety company whose seal is affixed. A seal must be affixed to the signature of the obligor. The seal may be wax, wafer, or impression. All erasures and interlineations made prior or subsequent to the execution of the bond must be initialed by the obligor and by the approving officer. The initials of the parties constitute their acceptance of the changes so initialed. Either a surety company bond or a United States Treasury Bond may be furnished. If a surety company bond is furnished it must be executed on this form by an acceptable surety company whose name appears on a current Treasury Department Form 356. The bond should show the rate and amount of premium charged for execution of the bond and there shall be attached thereto a currently valid instrument showing the authority of the agent of the surety company to execute the bond. If a United States Treasury Bond is furnished, the person depositing it must be the actual owner thereof. It must be a negotiable coupon bond that is not redeemable within one year of the date of deposit and the person depositing such security must sign and seal the immigration bond on this form and execute the appro- priate pledge and power of attorney. Any charges made by the depository for accepting United States bonds or notes must be borne by the alien or the owner of the security. A bond that alien shall not become a public charge may also be secured by an actual deposit of cash equal to the sum of the bond, and the person depositing such cash must sign and seal the bond and execute the appropriate pledge and power of attorney.
